cards.title: Right here with you
cards.body: You showed up. That’s what they needed. Take a breath. You’re still the safe place.

cards.title: Name the feeling
cards.body: Say it simply: “That was really hard. You got so frustrated.” No fix, just naming.

cards.title: One clear line
cards.body: One sentence. “We’re not hitting. I’m here.” Then quiet presence.

cards.title: Reset your nervous system
cards.body: You don’t have to fix it this second. Breathe. Your calm is the first tool.

cards.title: Repair is enough
cards.body: You can say: “I didn’t like how I said that. I’m sorry.” That’s repair. No long talk needed.

cards.title: Same plan, I’m here
cards.body: Bath, books, bed. Same plan every night. You don’t have to negotiate. Just repeat the next step calmly.

cards.title: One more hug, then bed
cards.body: Offer one brief connection: “One more hug, then we’re going to sleep.” Then follow through without reopening the deal.

cards.title: Quiet presence
cards.body: Keep it minimal. “I’m here. It’s still sleep time.” Low voice, one sentence, then wait.

cards.title: Touch and one line
cards.body: A hand on their back. “You’re safe. Back to sleep.” No long conversation. Your presence does the work.

cards.title: Early wake, calm start
cards.body: When they’re up before the window: keep the room dim, one short phrase. “Still rest time. I’ll be back when it’s morning.”

cards.title: Big feelings, you’re safe
cards.body: After the storm: “That was really big. You’re safe. I’m right here.” No lesson yet. Just safety.

cards.title: Limit and presence
cards.body: One line: “We don’t hit. I’m staying close.” Then stay. No extra words until they’re calmer.

cards.title: Name it, then wait
cards.body: “You wanted X and you couldn’t have it. That’s really frustrating.” Then give space. Don’t fix or persuade.

cards.title: You’re not failing
cards.body: Hard moments don’t mean you’re doing it wrong. You came back. That’s what matters.

cards.title: Pause before you speak
cards.body: When you feel the wave: breathe once. One sentence is enough. You can repair after.
